nodes.bodyText: Assuming you don't have nulls or dupes you can collect to toImmutableSortedMap
There is a toImmutableSortedSet you can use

commit.message:
Resolve bound variables case-insensitively

Currently, TypeSignatures are in the in-between world of
SQL identifiers and internal representation of those identifiers.
Sometimes they are constructed manually. Other times, they are parsed.
However, type variables are not accessed while taking into account
SQL delimited identifier semantics.

For example, a type signature such as array(e) is equivalent to
ARRAY(e) but not to array(E) due to some callsites matching the `e`
parameter without regards to whether it was quoted in the textual
form of the signature.

Fix parsing of row(double precision)

It was being interpreted as row("double" precision)
because "double" was being interpreted as an identifier
representing the field name.
